howItWorks.title: âš¡ How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Simple 4-step process to translate your subtitle files professionally in under a minute.

upload.title: Upload Your SRT File
upload.description: Drag and drop your subtitle file or click to browse. We support standard SRT format files up to 10MB in size.

selectLanguage.title: Select Target Language
selectLanguage.description: Choose from 31 supported languages. Our interface automatically detects your source language for convenience.

chooseEngine.title: Choose Translation Engine
chooseEngine.description: Pick Google Translate for speed and broad language support, or OpenAI for more nuanced, context-aware translations.

download.title: Download Results
download.description: Click translate and download your professionally translated SRT file within seconds. All timing and formatting preserved.

faq.title: â“ Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get answers to common questions about our SRT translation service and technical capabilities.

formats.question: What file formats do you support?
formats.answer: We currently support SRT (SubRip Subtitle) files, the most widely used subtitle format. Support for additional formats like VTT and ASS is coming soon.

fileSize.question: How large can my SRT file be?
fileSize.answer: You can upload SRT files up to 10MB in size, which typically contains several hours of subtitle content.

speed.question: How long does translation take?
speed.answer: Most subtitle files are translated within 10-30 seconds, depending on file size and selected translation engine.

security.question: Is my content secure and private?
security.answer: Yes, your files are processed securely and automatically deleted from our servers after translation. We never store or share your content.

engine.question: Which translation engine should I choose?
engine.answer: Google Translate is faster and supports more language combinations, while OpenAI provides more contextually accurate translations, especially for conversational content.

batch.question: Do you support batch translation?
batch.answer: Currently, you can translate one SRT file at a time. Batch processing features are planned for future updates.

google.title: Google Translate Engine
google.bestFor: Fast translations and rare language pairs
google.strengths: Lightning-fast processing, supports the widest range of languages, excellent for technical content
google.idealWhen: You need quick results or are translating between less common language pairs

openai.title: OpenAI Translation Engine
openai.strengths: Better understanding of context, idioms, and conversational language, more human-like results
openai.idealWhen: Quality is priority over speed, translating dialogue-heavy content, or need natural-sounding results

engineComparison.note: Both engines maintain perfect SRT formatting and timing, so you can choose based on your specific needs for speed versus quality.
